dt.t: Cooling begins when the lava makes {wi}contact{/wi} with the air.

dt: {bc}the apparent touching or mutual tangency of the limbs of two celestial bodies or of the disk of one body with the shadow of another during an eclipse, transit, or occultation
{bc}the junction of two electrical conductors through which a current passes
{bc}a special part made for such a junction

dt.t: The camera's flash wasn't working because the electrical {wi}contacts{/wi} needed to be cleaned.
I lost {wi}contact{/wi} with her years ago.

dt: {bc}an establishing of communication with someone or an observing or receiving of a significant signal from a person or object
{bc}a person serving as a go-between, messenger, connection, or source of special information

dt.t: She wears {wi}contacts{/wi} more often than glasses.

et: borrowed from French & Latin; French, going back to Middle French, borrowed from Latin {it}contāctus{/it} "touching, joining of surfaces, association," from {it}contag-,{/it} variant stem of {it}contingere{/it} "to be in contact with, arrive at, affect, fall to one's lot" + {it}-tus,{/it} suffix of action nouns {ma}{mat|contingent:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: the apparent touching or mutual tangency of the limbs of two celestial bodies or of the disk of one body with the shadow of another during an eclipse, transit, or occultation
the junction of two electrical conductors through which a current passes

dt.t: the point at which the two surfaces {wi}contact{/wi}

dt: {bc}to enter or be in contact with {bc}{sx|join||}

pt: The use of {it}contact{/it} as a verb, especially in sense 2b, is accepted as standard by almost all commentators except those who write college handbooks.

shortdef: to enter or be in contact with : join

dt: {bc}maintaining, involving, or activated or caused by contact

shortdef: maintaining, involving, or activated or caused by contact

shortdef: a hitter in baseball who seldom strikes out

dt: {bc}to identify, notify, and monitor individuals who may have had close contact with a person having a confirmed or probable case of infectious disease {bc}to engage in the practice of {d_link|contact tracing|contact tracing}

dt.t: How well a college {wi}contact traces{/wi}, places infected students in isolation, disseminates a steady stream of messaging to students about following safety practices and punishes offenders all have an impact on how much the virus spreads, [Gonzalo] Bearman said.
Campbell County Public Health … also {wi}contact traces{/wi} for diseases like measles and whooping cough, where a dozen cases qualifies as an outbreak.

Yet the only way we'll all win is if we'll do everything possible between now and then—wear a mask, wash our hands, socially distance, {wi}contact trace{/wi}—to put this coronavirus permanently in our rearview mirror in order to return to our old normal every hour of every day.

dt: {bc}to identify and notify (someone) through contact tracing

dt.t: {ldquo}Our school has done the best they can to keep us all as safe as possible, but I just happened to be in an unfortunate situation and ended being {wi}contact traced{/wi}. I am choosing to focus on all of the positive experiences I had this season and the great memories I made with my team.{rdquo}

shortdef: to identify, notify, and monitor individuals who may have had close contact with a person having a confirmed or probable case of infectious disease : to engage in the practice of contact tracing
to identify and notify (someone) through contact tracing
